alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Delaware; Franklin; Madison; Union (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CHAMPAIGN COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO, NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHWESTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO, NORTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO, NORTHEASTERN MADISON AND SOUTHEASTERN UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Choctaw Lake, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dublin, Marysville, Powell, Plain City, Mechanicsburg, Choctaw Lake, New California, Brighton, Milford Center, Shawnee Hills, Ostrander, Catawba, Unionville Center, Rosedale, State Route 4 at State Route 161, Resaca, US Route 33 at US Route 42, Catawba Station, Columbus Zoo and Amity. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 67 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Champaign; Clark; Delaware; Franklin; Madison; Union
